subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: An alternative to the usual ghost hunter stuff.
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_014D_01C9BDE1.29CE0A70
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

It's not that I don't want to test it, it is that I can't. It would be inte=
resting and I would do it if I could.

But again, this test could really on=
ly rule out psychic interference from you. It is too subjective and therefo=
re cannot stand as a measurement for other tests of this nature by itself.
=

If it failed to get your number, that would not mean that it couldn't get =
someone else's number or that someone else couldn't influence it. That woul=
d also not mean that answers it had gotten in the past weren't correct, com=
ing from a living being or a spirit.  It would not prove anything, except t=
hat it was not acting on any psychic vibrations from you personally.

If it=
 got your number correct, that doesn't even help immediately, because it co=
uld get the answer on mere chance.

The only way to prove here that it is b=
eing psychically influenced would be to run several tests of the same natur=
e. Then, if it scored correct higher then mere chance, only then could you =
say that the board can be psychically tampered with. Still, that is the onl=
y thing you could say for certain. That would not rule out the possibility =
that spirits can communicate through it.

 So we would be left with more qu=
estions. Is it that it is being psychically tampered with by a human mind d=
irectly? Is it and actual entity reading someone's mind? Can it be both?

S=
ee what I am sayin'?


  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Rj 
  To: EV=
P-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, April 15, 2009 3:03 PM
  Subject:=
 Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: An alternative to the usual ghost hunter stuff.





   =
     If you don't want to test it, I understand.  This is only a suggestion=
 for people who want to test it.  An objective test, such as this, would be=
 I think a good way to determine its accuracy.  And its accuracy is what ca=
rries over into its overall performance and value.  If you have no measurem=
ent as to the accuracy of its results, or of a given methodology, then that=
 brings into questions its overall results, and so, its other answers.

   =
     Again, though, if you don't want to test it, I understand.

        --=
- On Wed, 4/15/09, April Abercrombie <april@...> w=
rote:


          From: April Abercrombie <april@abercrombieghostresearch.c=
om>
          Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: An alternative to the usual ghost =
hunter stuff.
          To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
          Date: Wednesd=
ay, April 15, 2009, 1:48 PM



          "> If it can't get it correct, I s=
uppose that brings into suspect all its other answers."

          All that=
 really does is rule out psychic interference from you and the operator. So=
 that would say nothing either way about all its other answers.


         =
   ----- Original Message ----- 
            From: Rick 
            To: EV=
P-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
            Sent: Wednesday, April 15, 2009 2:24 PM=

            Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: An alternative to the usual ghost hunte=
r stuff.



            Anyone have any luck with this calibration experime=
nt?

            (Note this experiment isn't for anyone who just likes to p=
lay around with their board, and doesn't really care to know its accuracy. =
This is for those interested in determining how well their board approach w=
orks).

            --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com, "Rick" <rasterer@.. .>=
 wrote:
            >
            > If anyone feels like calibrating their =
board, or wants to know if they can get accurate information from it, I hav=
e written down a number between 1 and a billion (1,000,000,000)
           =
 > 
            > Let me know what your board thinks it is. 
            > =
If it gets it correct, sounds like you've got something important going on =
there!
            > 
            > If it can't get it correct, I suppose t=
hat brings into suspect all its other answers.
            > 
            >=
 
            > 
            > 
            > 
            > --- In EVP-ITC=
@yahoogroups .com, "threadsintyme@ " <Threadsintyme@ > wrote:
            >=
 >
            > > Hi Lori,
            > > Glad that you brought this up! =
A true medium can give you a lot of the details that Ouija boards can't. Th=
ey can also give you complete names, dates, info that is totally unknown to=
 others (except for those directly involved). 
            > > There are so=
me excellent readings on YouTube and I don't mean the crappy ones...I forgo=
t what this one guy's name was (he is in spirit now) but he could tel you d=
etails!! I almost my skin chill...
            > > I will see if I can loca=
te some of those highly respected members of Spiritualism and will post tho=
se here for all of you to watch.
            > > Blessings,
            > >=
 Al
            > > 
            > > ---------- Original Message ----------=

            > > From: lori bogren <loribogren@ >
            > > To: <evp-=
itc@yahoogroups .com>
            > > Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] An alternative=
 to the usual ghost hunter stuff.
            > > Date: Fri, 10 Apr 2009 19=
:11:33 -0500
            > > 
            > > 
            > > 
           =
 > > 
            > > April~
            > > 
            > > You forgot ya=
wn from boredom, that's what I do.
            > > 
            > > Use it,=
 don't use it. I don't care. But why bother. When people ask me I usually s=
uggest that if they want to communicate with ... whatever why not develop t=
he ability yourself. - ya, I'm one of those who believe anyone can.
       =
     > > 
            > > There's always the question in the back of your m=
ind whether your partner's moving it. The intentions of "what" you are talk=
ing to. Not to mention it's too slow and limited.
            > > 
        =
    > > Besides if you take the time to develop the ability you can get mor=
e texture in the information. Asking the board "where you married?" may get=
 you a "yes" but a psychic might get the sense of a religious or civil cere=
monhy, the garment(s) worn, other's in the party, or whether that Being app=
roved/disapprove d of their spouse (ie was it a reluctant union).
         =
   > > 
            > > ~Lori
            > > 
            > > "My life is =
boring, my fantasies are a theme park." --Anne Rice Responding to an interv=
iewer who just did not get it. 
            > > 
            > > To: EVP-IT=
C@yahoogroups .com
            > > From: april@
            > > Date: Fri, =
10 Apr 2009 08:32:45 -0600
            > > Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] An altern=
ative to the usual ghost hunter stuff.
            > > 
            > > .Ye=
ah-that's the problem with it I have found too. Most people, when you menti=
on Ouija, either run screaming, or bring up religion. ----- Original Messag=
e ----- From: Frank Sumption To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com Sent: Friday, Apr=
il 10, 2009 8:26 AMSubject: Re: [EVP-ITC] An alternative to the usual ghost=
 hunter stuff.
